author: Deepa H
text:
Container lorries line up on Ennore Express Highway near Kasimedu Fishing Harbour, on Friday —Photo: B.Jothi Ramalingam

Drivers of container lorries transporting goods for export and import from Chennai Port Trust refused to withdraw their strike, demanding a permanent solution to delays in processing of containers inside the port.

Talks involving the police, trailer owners, drivers, port officials and Chennai Container Terminal Limited (CCTL) officials failed to reach a conclusion on Friday.

E. Kalimuthu, secretary of the drivers and cleaners association, said though CCTL officials had agreed to speed up the processing, the drivers refused to relent.

“They say they want the old system of management by drivers to be brought back to avoid delays. The wait on the road leading to the port is really endless,” he said.

Selvam, a driver, said they were fed up with not being able to enter the port with minimum waiting time.

Over 4, 000 trailers carrying containers wait on the roads leading to the Chennai Port Trust every day causing traffic problems in highly-congested north Chennai.
title: Lorry stir continues
